657385885.name: Simple classic Catholic Church
657385885.author: a TripAdvisor user
657385885.reviewBody: It\u2019s a still in use church with a lot of people who still concur it, the place seems lively and still seems to be a traditional place to visit I like many new towns that have lost their cultural heritage

569719869.name: Nice Church
569719869.author: a TripAdvisor user
569719869.reviewBody: Try to catch a service with choir and organ.  Great acoustics, nice restoration from earthquake damage.

398221438.name: Beautiful Cathedral!
398221438.author: a TripAdvisor user
398221438.reviewBody: It\u00b4s not so big than others but is beautiful, you can found it on the downtown and maybe you want an icecream after the visit.

372745188.name: Astonish faith
372745188.author: a TripAdvisor user
372745188.reviewBody: We were surprise with this catholic cathedral is beautiful the architecture, the colors... but more than that was the faith of the people, wow..... We highly recommend it.

365280277.name: Bells of Joy and Celebration
365280277.author: a TripAdvisor user
365280277.reviewBody: The cathedral is well maintained and has a spectacular alter, and the doors look very old and distinguished. But the rest of the church is plain except for the bell towers and Dome.\nThe bells are numerous and they are well used to call to service and to celebrate special events.  A range of sizes and tones, with the bell ringers standing in the towers next to some of the bells.

346410608.name: Wonderful Masterpiece!
346410608.author: a TripAdvisor user
346410608.reviewBody: One already feels like they are in Europe before walking in to the Cathedral - Minor Basilica, but once entering, you\'re transformed to another place and time.  Incredible history, particularly when you learn about San Miguel de la Mora and his role in Colima during the Christian persecution/Cristero War.  Unfortunately, there don\'t appear to be any organized tours, but do like I did and ask a local for a history.

252648642.name: very spanish square and church
252648642.author: a TripAdvisor user
252648642.reviewBody: just go and you will like it. the church surrounded by a beautiful garden and spanish building, and some good mexican restaurants on the square. inside church is beautiful too. worth to stay hour or two and relax there. \nOn the north there are a few parking, charge 10 peso per hr. not bad.

244759242.name: Wow!
244759242.author: a TripAdvisor user
244759242.reviewBody: All the gold leaf and the beauty is worth just poking your head in. Very powerful in its elegance and history.

152391228.name: Beautiful Architecture
152391228.author: a TripAdvisor user
152391228.reviewBody: Beautiful a lot of history. The cathedral is near the portales which is a place where people gather and there was a quiosco where they had music.

125248804.name: A grand Cathedral
125248804.author: a TripAdvisor user
125248804.reviewBody: A must see on the square. Beautiful architecture immaculate condition

625862336.name: Mexico\'s most active volcano
625862336.author: a TripAdvisor user
625862336.reviewBody: There are many options for tours to and around this volcano, including hikes, bikes, ATV, and some good camping options as well...The scenery around here is beautiful

569720347.name: Rivalling Mt. Fuji
569720347.author: a TripAdvisor user
569720347.reviewBody: Volcano now quiet, so no eruptions, but on a clear day, spectacular views, especially from the Alta Zona golf course and housing development

521586845.name: Great place, stay at Comala
521586845.author: a TripAdvisor user
521586845.reviewBody: I stayed at Comala for few nights. Unfortunately because of rain and clouds almost didn\'t see the Volcano.Better to do it at the season. I took a private tour for 600 pesos, by Jupiter. Ask locals. Also it a nice towns near Volcano.

508151207.name: Beautiful hike
508151207.author: a TripAdvisor user
508151207.reviewBody:
My husband and I went with family to hike up to the antennas, which is roughly around 12,000 ft. With absolutely no altitude training, I was able to make it to the antennas at a nice slow, pace. The road is nice and wide. The only difficult part of it was the altitude. I found it really helped to sip on coke and take 2 extra strength tylenol to thin the blood. 

Gorgeous views once at the antenna. It is possible to get to the top of the volcano (about another 2000 ft gain), but we didn't do it this time. 

It is about an hour and fifteen minutes from Ciudad Guzman. It takes about an hour "off roading" so you need a 4x4 to get up. A very bumpy ride so for those with motion sickness take some meds. 

There was nobody else on the hike, so that was nice. Also there is an outhouse at the beginning of the hike. 

Would definitely go go back!

466390181.name: Plan One day trip (if Volcan is NOT active)))
466390181.author: a TripAdvisor user
466390181.reviewBody: 2 hours to get UP, and 3 hours to get down - watch your brakes  ( 4x4 recommended) View from the top was incredible

462543706.name: A nice view, even when it isn\'t erupting
462543706.author: a TripAdvisor user
462543706.reviewBody: The famous Volcano of Fire was quiet the day we visited, but the towering cinder cone was an impressive sight nonetheless. There are several places to pull over on the highway, offering a variety of perspectives, but these are not developed overlooks. Be sure to pull well off the road to avoid being rear-ended!

344739445.name: An active volcano that is putting on quite the show.
344739445.author: a TripAdvisor user
344739445.reviewBody: We use to live near the volcano in 2004-2007 when it was only slightly active.  Now, things are happening and often.

285570475.name: Volcan
285570475.author: a TripAdvisor user
285570475.reviewBody: It was great to see lave valcano................simply the great experience.....fantastic view remembered life time

257148606.name: Five Stars for Mother Nature
257148606.author: a TripAdvisor user
257148606.reviewBody: Where else in the world can you watch an active volcano erupt in steam an ash about every 3 hours? This is well worth a side trip to see. We stayed in Comala, at a clean, safe and inexpensive hostel. The plaza is busy in the evenings. Little shops and cafes around the plaza. We are going back in two week because there is so much to do there.

209018353.name: Magical
209018353.author: a TripAdvisor user
209018353.reviewBody: The most thrilling experience to be right there seeing it in person!  The drive up was so beautiful, all the wild flowers and the view just spectacular. We are going back again before the rainy season! \nJust Epic!

166398823.name: Go in winter
166398823.author: a TripAdvisor user
166398823.reviewBody: I went in juin, rainseason and for that reason I couldn`t see the top of the volcano. It was too cloudy. But still I really loved it. The scenery is beautiful!

151426605.name: Good hiking
151426605.author: a TripAdvisor user
151426605.reviewBody: It\'s beautiful to hike from La Yerba Buena up the side of the volcano.  It\'s especially majestic in the winter when there\'s some snow on the top.\n\nThe view of the volcanoes from Colima are great.

123024549.name: An Active Volcano where you can see the clouds of smole
123024549.author: a TripAdvisor user
123024549.reviewBody: If you make a trip to Colima, about an hours drive from Manzanillo, go through Comala, past the "Magic Zone" and you can get a great view of the Volcano. It seems as if its ready to blow and the people in the area all have stories, theories. fantasy storires, that predict the next eruption of lava. Located near the Volcano is a unique hotel with a small Chapel that was built in honor of a Saint who saved the people in the area from the last eruption. \nEven though there have been many attempts,Its almost impossible to get to the top of the Volcano so save your energy and see its beauty from below.

120505530.name: 50 minutes from Manzanillo
120505530.author: a TripAdvisor user
120505530.reviewBody: Take a tour to Colima!  You will love it.  It\'s an exceptional city and the volcano tour includes some interesting side trips!

15093609.name: There are two volcanos near Manzanillo
15093609.author: a TripAdvisor user
15093609.reviewBody: There are two volcanos near Manzanillo.  One is the Volcan de Fuego.  It is the active volcano.  The other Volcan/volcano is snow capped, and inactive.  We took a side trip to see the volcanos and were disappointed.  During the morning, it was overcast, and we couldn\'t see the volcanos.  After lunch in Comala, it had cleared up good enough to see one volcano in between the buildings of downtown.  I understand that you can\'t get any closer than 11 kilometers from the active volcano, because it was steaming.

561137969.name: Beautiful Square in City Centre
561137969.author: a TripAdvisor user
561137969.reviewBody: Far and away the Jardin Nunez is the most beautiful square we encountered on our trip along the west coast. The importance of the square to the city is obvious by the pride taken in its care and design, an outstanding green space. Bounded by a cathedral, government buildings (Colima is the provincial capital), shops and a Best Western Hotel, it is worth visiting this central part of Colima. \n\nWe were pleasantly surprised and impressed by the city of Colima itself. As the seat of the provincial government and the location of several institutions of higher learning, the prosperity and progressive business climate in Colima is obvious. If it were located on the coast as opposed to several kilometres inland, it would be a much more well known, popular destination for visitors! We\u2019ll visit again!

address.streetAddress: Revolucion s/n Madero, Col. Colima Centro

555636245.name: nice green space in a good to walk around town
555636245.author: a TripAdvisor user
555636245.reviewBody: Colima is a find..we stayed right on the square, and there was always something happening, especially due to the christmas celebrations...people were helpful and friendly.  the one way streets were a little challenging but once we found our hotel and parked the rental car all was good. Plenty of places to eat and shops in the central city...  on our way to Guadalajra we went thru the suburbs, and the next time here, we will take a bus and explore some of those areas as well

address.streetAddress: Revolucion s/n Madero, Col. Colima Centro

482697710.name: Ample green space.
482697710.author: a TripAdvisor user
482697710.reviewBody: Medium sized park in the city center, lots of green areas, good for a picnic, a walk, or jogging, nice fountain in the center, beware of falling coconuts, those palm trees are quite "active".

address.streetAddress: Revolucion s/n Madero, Col. Colima Centro

588588073.name: Great tour to El Salto Waterfalls
588588073.author: a TripAdvisor user
588588073.reviewBody: The trip to the falls is on a very winding road but quite scenic. The falls themselves are amazing. Very refreshing.

562783593.name: So pretty
562783593.author: a TripAdvisor user
562783593.reviewBody:
We went with Francisco of Tlaloc Tours and had a great time. He is based out of the Tesoro Resort but I have his contact info if you want. PM me and I will send it to you. Excellent English!!!

He knew we had some diabetics with us so he even made sure to put some diet pop in the cooler along with beer, regular pop and water. If you are a diabetic in Mexico, you know how hard it is at times to find diet pop.

He took us first to a place that offered milk straight from the cow. Sounds icky but was pretty darn good. They put in some chocolate powder, then cane alcohol to kill any bacteria, then milk the cow into the glass. Tasted like a chocolate milkshake. We then drove about halfway when he stopped at a small store for anyone who needed the bathroom. A small break and great for getting road snacks. He made sure to point out the "sleeping woman" in the mountains as we were driving there. 

Once we arrived at el Salto, we all, including Francisco got changed into our bathing suits. A few of us played in the water park for a bit. The water is fed by the same source as the waterfall so it is clean and cool, not full of chemicals. When we were finished playing we went for the short walk to the waterfall. We were not allowed to bring glass bottles but that is understandable. There is a picnic area as well as bathrooms on the way to the falls if you are going to drive there yourselves. We walked down the stairs to the bottom and Francisco helped us across to a rocky area where we could post for pictures or play go into the water to play in the waterfall. There is a small creek the waterfall empties into that you can play in as well. This leads to a small beach. As I was the one taking pictures I didn't get a chance to see the beach. You should wear water shoes as the rocks are a little slippery. I could not figure out why Francisco got changed, but he comes into the water with you to make sure you are safe.

When we were done playing in the waterfall, we went back up and had a yummy lunch that was waiting for us. We had so much food we were stuffed. I said that all that was missing was a hammock and the guy who made our lunch went into the back and brought one for me to lay on. He tied it up and I was in heaven. Some people relaxed and dried off while others went back into the waterpark until it was time to leave.

This was a fun excursion and we didn't feel rushed like some others we have been on.

555887987.name: 1.5 Hours outside the city, small nature park
555887987.author: a TripAdvisor user
555887987.reviewBody: This was a small nature park about 1.5 hours outside the city. Not exactly what I was expecting, there was some build-out of picnic tables and an above the ground pool, to kind of make this place an attraction, but it was not very appealing.  5 minute walk from the parking area to a little waterfall, it had rained so the water was not clear. But this was interesting to see. For how far the drive was outside of Manzanillo I would not really recommend this, unless you were desperate for something to do.

473881021.name: A Pleasant Drive
473881021.author: a TripAdvisor user
473881021.reviewBody: The drive is slow and peaceful as you send your way up to the Waterfall Park. At the top of the park just off the highway is a a water park and picnic area. When we were there it was clean and many people were enjoying the features. Further down is the waterfall and river. The viewing area is readily accessible, less so the river itself. While several people were enjoying the pools and river you need to be agile and surefooted to get down to it.

447578057.name: Butterfly Paradise
447578057.author: a TripAdvisor user
447578057.reviewBody:
What a strange place. The road was great and the directions easy. It was wierd to drive past some grim characters, straight out of a Tarantino movie, full ready with assault rifles, and that grim look.

They were guarding the Iron mine. Which goes to show you that private armies are real- when you can afford to hire them.

El Salto itself was run down. Which is too bad. The place is butterfly heaven. We made a point of swimming the Canyon and trying to hike around.

Unfortunately, the trash around here is ubiquitous. I get that poverty breeds a lack of environmental respect- but the sloppiness around this place hits a new level. It should be normal to see the people do something other then throw their garbage in the river. Like find a common dump place, or act like decent human beings.

Unfortunately, Mexico is one of those head scratching places, where the opportunity for greatness is overwhelmed by corruption and weak leadership.

360520346.name: Check out this wonderful waterfall.... and skip the water park!
360520346.author: a TripAdvisor user
360520346.reviewBody: What a beautiful site! My family and I truly liked this site which is a wonderful natural formation... we loved it! It is roughly an hour from downtown Colima but it is a very enjoyable countryside drive. Enjoy the waterfall but plan on skipping the water park that isn\'t very well kept nor develeped... Hope this helps!\nPS - The waterfall is reputed to be quite dangerous UNDER the falls --local lore is that a young man tried swimming under, was caught in the torrent, a friend went in after him and then a third... none came out alive.

325125898.name: Great waterfall
325125898.author: a TripAdvisor user
325125898.reviewBody: This is a beautiful area of Colima, unfortunately, the park is not very well maintained which is unfortunate as it would be a lovely place to have a picnic or stop off on your way to Colima.

264574300.name: Drive is worth the site......The site is worth the drive
264574300.author: a TripAdvisor user
264574300.reviewBody: We have lived part-time within 1.5 hours of El Salto falls for near 20 years and just yesterday we visited there. It was about 1.5 hours from Colima, Colima by very good but winding narrow road.  It was the second week of Mexican vacaciones so there were quite a few people at the kioskas on top of the parque.  But down the trail near the falls there was hardly anyone.\ni would recommend to anyone as even I with a bad ankle could easily manage the trail.  We drove on to Manzanillo as we had family(friends) from Mexico City with us and they wanted to walk on the beach a little.  So we went on to the little beach town of Pariso for comida at a typical beach restuarant.  We had pulpo, camarones etc.....pretty ordinary.

251184483.name: loved our day
251184483.author: a TripAdvisor user
251184483.reviewBody:
After the reading the reviews, here I wasn't sure what to expect, but we just loved it.  We are a family of 4 with 2 kids ages 4/6.  Left Manzanillo around 10:30 and we were swimming in the falls by 12:00.  It is true that the drive has beautiful views and deadly turns.  Just take it slow and be sure to stick to your side of the road!  There is a huge sign for the park on the right hand side, so you really can't miss it.  We came on a monday in January and had the entire park to ourselves.

At the parking lot level there are watersides for the kids, picnic tables, swimming pools and bathrooms.  The infrastructure is very old and in need of repairs.  Don't come here for the watersides or bathrooms.  There were no food or beverage options open (facilities were there, but they were all closed) when we were there and the closest corner store was a 10 min drive.   Bring plenty of Water and Food!

Head down from the main parking lot to the waterfalls.  Off to the left is the main fall which is beautiful to see for a few minutes, but the best part for us was off to the right where you can head down a path to swim in the river.  Here there are other waterfalls falling through the canyons and beautiful aqua green pools for swimming.  There were also caves for exploring.   Although it was january, there was plenty of water flow and it was warm (28deg - same temp as in manzanillo).

We played here for hours and our kids didn't want to leave.  We would certainly come back.

187181107.name: Was disappointed, to say the least
187181107.author: a TripAdvisor user
187181107.reviewBody: Firstly, I happened to be driving up on a day that the huge, iron ore trucks were barreling down the winding road to get to the train on time.  Crosses on most corners.  I was a wreck by the time I arrived.  Then, the bathroom was worse than I\'ve seen anywhere in Mexico.  Worse than Nigeria!  The falls and pools were quite lovely.  I went in December last year, so thee was not too much flow, but they were nice and it was nice to be able to paddle round in warm, fresh water in the small canyon.  I won\'t be going again.

142919413.name: Unfortunately, El Salto has not been maintained.
142919413.author: a TripAdvisor user
142919413.reviewBody: The grounds were dirty, with garbage blowing about. The buildings were crumbling, and there was graffiti on many rocks and concrete surfaces. The handrail at the waterfall had rusted through and fallen onto the rocks below.

126387262.name: excellent place on a hot day
126387262.author: a TripAdvisor user
126387262.reviewBody: Great place for a family picnic, highly recommend to pack a lunch and plan to go on a hot day to get maximum enjoyment, the air does feel a little cool down in the base of the falls, or you can choose a warmer spot at a higher spot until the heat of the day (rock flat top) with full view of the falls. Enjoy.

83665584.name: Nice and natural. Near minatitlan...
83665584.author: a TripAdvisor user
83665584.reviewBody: Nice and natural. Near minatitlan. Perfect for a family picnic and memorable pictures. Best if you arrive early because it take some road time.

557167315.name: History and ruins
557167315.author: a TripAdvisor user
557167315.reviewBody: This place is very accessible, not crowded at all.  you must bring hat or umbrella and your own water that you\'ll need.  The family there caretaking at the moment had their son there and we asked him to be our guide.  Hector even tried to read the signs in nahuatl, very cute.

555390853.name: Modest but pleasant site
555390853.author: a TripAdvisor user
555390853.reviewBody: We have seen all of the great meso-american cities Palenque, Copan, Tikal and others, so this site is truly modest by comparison.   We were the only people visiting.  There were no guides on the site.   There were some small detailed designs in the stone works.  There seem to be few archeological sites along the western slopes of Mexico so if one is interested it is worthwhile to stop here.

504050108.name: Beautiful, interesting
504050108.author: a TripAdvisor user
504050108.reviewBody: My father is from Colima and I\'ve visited a handful of times but this is my first visit to El Chanal. It is really and amazing site to see and not over run with tourist at all. In fact when we visited we were the only ones there for more than an hour! There are tons of artifacts and structures to explore and what\'s great is there are signs in English explaining what archeologists know about the different sections. Getting here is also very easy because there are signs and you just take a straight road from a main highway. Area is very safe. If you are visiting Colima and looking for things to do I\'d highly recommend a drive to visit El Chanal!

457754607.name: Beautiful
457754607.author: a TripAdvisor user
457754607.reviewBody: Very enlightening, wish Mexico could invest more in this national treasure, we were the only ones visiting that day.

424827733.name: Many questions and few answers: an archeological site in Colima, Mexico
424827733.author: a TripAdvisor user
424827733.reviewBody: We were on a one-day trip from Manzanillo to Colima and surrounding area and decided to take a look at El Chanal archeological site. With a rental car and a mobile phone with Waze app that is easily found. The site is quite huge although only a small area has been cleaned and is accesible. Many questions pop up: who were the people who inhabited this area? What did the place look like when it was in use? What was the purpose of the buildings? Very few answers are offered and not many of them quite convincing. I personally think the location of the buildings has to be understood in relation to the Colima vulcano but that speculation of mine was not supported by the few explanations, in spanish, english and n\u00e1huatl, on site. Worth a visit if you\u00b4re interested in archeology, just want to take some pictures or maybe spend an hour or so in solitude among silent testimonies from the past.

360086993.name: Gotta think back........
360086993.author: a TripAdvisor user
360086993.reviewBody: This is very interesting to history buffs. Very relaxing to walk through the grounds but I suggest doing so in the AM hours. There is no shade and it can be very hot.  A small donation is appropriate and this is a great place for youngsters to run off some energy.

354998798.name: Large area, signs in english too
354998798.author: a TripAdvisor user
354998798.reviewBody: We had the area almost to ourselves. Lots of features to explore, quite a few interpretive panels with descriptions in English. The stones were all rounded and brought from rivers, bound by clay type mortar. 55 peso per person fee. Spotless and well maintained.

299245308.name: Archaeological Site in El Chanal town close to the City of Colima
299245308.author: a TripAdvisor user
299245308.reviewBody: My husband and I visited this large Archaeological site during our 4-day stay in the City of Colima. This site is very well maintained by the villagers of the small town El Chanal. There is not a lot known about the original inhabitants of this ancient village. However, signs of religious activity is everywhere. There are many structures built around open plazas: Altars, Del Dia y la Noche (Day & Night), del Tiempo (Time), del Agua (Water), del Altar (this one is round and very large). The is also a Ballgame Court.

360084844.name: Easy view
360084844.author: a TripAdvisor user
360084844.reviewBody: One can walk thru this museum rather quickly or spend some time.It shows a good deal of history of the Colima region and is well worth the few pesos donation. If you are visiting Colima this downtown centro museum is well worth your time.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Ciudad de Colima

address.streetAddress: Centro de la Ciudad de Colima

357369497.name: Interesting general displays of local history
357369497.author: a TripAdvisor user
357369497.reviewBody: The museum was a little confusing to follow - rooms on the first and second level were not signed, numbered nor was there a route to follow. There were displays of movie projectors, telegraph machines, firearms, but there didn\'t appear to be a theme. There were a few photos of the earthquake damage in the 1930\'s & 1940\'s, but not enough to adequately survey the extent of the damage.\nThere\'s a little bit of everything here.

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Ciudad de Colima

address.streetAddress: Centro de la Ciudad de Colima

323058039.name: Nothing special
323058039.author: a TripAdvisor user
323058039.reviewBody: Visited with a group but was somewhat disappointed.\nThe archaeological exhibits were only of mild interest and one fwioed to see any explanations in English

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Ciudad de Colima

address.streetAddress: Centro de la Ciudad de Colima

284573349.name: Our History...
284573349.author: a TripAdvisor user
284573349.reviewBody: This is a great little museum, located in the heart of Colima, Colima. It offers artifacts from the prehispanic era as well as a replica of the "Tiro tomb" full of history and a brief insight to our rich land. You cannot miss this if you are strolling downtown. My boyfriend loved it. He was amazed with the detail and history of the artifacts. My son got an opportunity to see part our history too. A must see!

itemReviewed.name: Museo de la Ciudad de Colima

address.streetAddress: Centro de la Ciudad de Colima

348704353.name: Funky spot close to downtown
348704353.author: a TripAdvisor user
348704353.reviewBody: \rThis Caf\u00e9 and art gallery is worth a look. Funky and creative interior and a sample of some of Colima\u2019s new artists. Several options for entertainment: there\'s a bar serving artisan beers, a bakery serving baked good and coffee. \n

326117071.name: Cozy and fun
326117071.author: a TripAdvisor user
326117071.reviewBody: A nice place located in one of the most populars Corridors in downtown, in Andador Constituci\u00f3n. They have several events per week, most of them related to music, and/or art. They have artisanal beer, nice veggie pizzas to share with one or two friends, and also tapas. \nThey have art exhibitions, and a cool kinda hipster boutique

286233741.name: Stumbled on Magical Sunday Night Jazz
286233741.author: a TripAdvisor user
286233741.reviewBody: We came to see La Arteria for the art and shops, but found an incredibly talented Jazz ensemble starting a regular Sunday Night Jazz gathering. It was pure magic, with great artists creating magic together. If you are a music lover do not miss this in Colima. It is a sweet, casual venue with a limited food menu, serving beer and local mescal. You would pay a fortune for this if it was on any Jazz map!

660605896.name: Sensational drive and a neat experience at the end.
660605896.author: a TripAdvisor user
660605896.reviewBody: We drove up from Manzanillo to the turnoff for Ixtlahuacan and followed the signs up to the cave. It was about 80 minutes total and the road went from freeway to a good two lane blacktop to a two track cobblestone to a dirt road. All of it was well maintained and although slow it was interesting. At the top we parked, scouted around and found the metal spiral staircase that led down about 80 feet to the cave. We were greeted there by our good natured guide who collected our 250 peso fee for the 3 of us. Encouraging us to watch our heads and watch our step we entered the one large chamber. It was lit with a single white bulb which cast a shadowy light and made the stalagmites stand out. We posed for pictures and left as it was both humid and hot down there. Try it, you\u201dll like it

455905033.name: one of nicest secluded beach in Michoacan
455905033.author: a TripAdvisor user
455905033.reviewBody: it is remote, no hotel but it is wide open. i am not a surfer but most people who are there are surfers.  be careful of currents.  take your own food. it is near the faro (lighthouse) beach near Tecoman on highway 200. need to get a taxi from main road  50p.  it is laid back. mosltly camping.  relax and enjoy.

16041630.name: Beutiful hidden beach in Pacific Coast Mexico
16041630.author: a TripAdvisor user
16041630.reviewBody:
This is a beutiful beach which has no hotels and almost no tourists... it's a lonely beach but very beutiful, it's for people who love being in touch with nature. 
You have to camp there, take your own food but if you go for a weekend you will spend 50 USD as much and have a great weekend... it has great waves for surfing and it's a quiet beutiful beach for spending with friends or you can go as a couple.
Is open sea and you should go to Tecomán in Colima Mexico
then go straight and when you will get to another beach name "El Faro" once you get ther "La Llorona" is 2 km. away.
Its better if you take your car because only local buses go there

549709505.name: Plaza san fernando
549709505.author: a TripAdvisor user
549709505.reviewBody: No es una atraccio  turistica es un centro comercial mas pero muy variado encontraras farmacia, ropa, joyeria, fast food, cine y un tipo sears de la region.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion 555 Col. Lomas de Circunvalacion

541676999.name: Pequeno shopping mall
541676999.author: a TripAdvisor user
541676999.reviewBody: Plaza San Fernando \u00e9 um pequeno shopping mall em Colima. A maioria das lojas \u00e9 de vestu\u00e1rio. Possui estacionamento e uma pracayde alimenta\u00e7\u00e3o com boa op\u00e7\u00e3o.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion 555 Col. Lomas de Circunvalacion

502061501.name: Muy bueno
502061501.author: a TripAdvisor user
502061501.reviewBody: Plaza con m\u00faltiples establecimientos de variados t\u00f3picos.\nGran cantidad de opciones para compras, comida y entretenimiento.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion 555 Col. Lomas de Circunvalacion

484984421.name: Se ha transformado en un buen lugar
484984421.author: a TripAdvisor user
484984421.reviewBody: Al paso de los a\u00f1os no se le ha dejado de invertir capital para convertir la Plaza San Fernando en un lugar agradable para comer, comprar, ir al cine, etc. Cuenta con amplio estacionamiento y buena seguridad.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion 555 Col. Lomas de Circunvalacion

480786584.name: Muy concurrida.
480786584.author: a TripAdvisor user
480786584.reviewBody: Es una plaza muy concurrida, encuentras de todo. \nLa zona de comida tiene una buena variedad.\nEs una buena opci\u00f3n para pasar un rato de distracci\u00f3n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion 555 Col. Lomas de Circunvalacion

460096895.name: lugar para ir de compras
460096895.author: a TripAdvisor user
460096895.reviewBody: en esta plaza comercial, hay muchas tiendas para  ir de compras,pasar un rato agradabel, tambien puedes ir al cine, ya que hay un cinepolis en la plaza, existe un area de comida rapida con muchas opciones, desde pizzas, comida italiana y japonesa, hasta ensaladas y pasteles, para pasar el rato es una muy buena opci\u00f3n

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion 555 Col. Lomas de Circunvalacion

450868045.name: Est\u00e1 perdiendo puntos sin los restaurantes del exterior
450868045.author: a TripAdvisor user
450868045.reviewBody: La plaza siempre se mantiene limpia y muy bonita solo que est\u00e1 perdiendo algunos puntos sin sus restaurantes que normalmente estaban en el exterior como el kukara o el otro que estaba de cortes o algo as\u00ed. En fin. Deseo que pronto haya un buen empresario haciendo lucir esa excelente zona.

address.streetAddress: Avenida Constitucion 555 Col. Lomas de Circunvalacion

497887014.name: Centrally Located and quick to see
497887014.author: a TripAdvisor user
497887014.reviewBody: Sitting on the corner of the main square the museum is easy to find, and small enough that it is well worth the walk through to see some of the local history. Some nice displays even though it is a little museum.

462542900.name: A quick but informative tour through the state\'s history
462542900.author: a TripAdvisor user
462542900.reviewBody: Covering everything from Neolithic cultures to the mid-20th Century, this museum spans the history of much of this small state, not just its capital city. It tends to be long on informative texts, in Spanish, and short on artifacts, except for the last couple of rooms, which display some impressive pieces of indigenous pottery, including the distinctive chubby little dogs with pointy ears, apparently raised for food as well as for pets.

379792550.name: Located right on the main zocalo, best place to learn the history of the state
379792550.author: a TripAdvisor user
379792550.reviewBody: It is a walk through time.  It is organized chronologically with rooms starting in pre Columbian times and working its way up to modern times.  Situated in a nice colonial building, it is a nice break from the heat.  Worth the few peso price of admission.

325119455.name: Colima City
325119455.author: a TripAdvisor user
325119455.reviewBody: Interesting collection and history of the people to found Colima. Our tour guide was very knowledgeable. A beautiful city with narrow streets and wonderful restaurants.

269294194.name: Bad Timing
269294194.author: a TripAdvisor user
269294194.reviewBody: Everything was closed because it was Good Friday.  Not anyone\'s mistake but shouldhave been told lots would be closed due to the holiday

258832079.name: Great, brief history lesson on Colima
258832079.author: a TripAdvisor user
258832079.reviewBody: Wasn\'t cheap (52 pesos) but it was a quick, easy tour and very informative. It is self-guided with the tour brochure they let you borrow. The exhibits are numbered so it is easy to follow along with the brochure.  I spent about an hour there, I think 1 to 1.5 hours is about the maximum amount of time you\'d spend here. I would recommend if you are interested in history.

123415307.name: A brilliant museum with a little of everything
123415307.author: a TripAdvisor user
123415307.reviewBody: Colima Colima Colima has something for everyone and so does this musuem. From the Spaniards to the Ancients, plus modern sculputure display when I was there, it is a great place to spend a few hours before wandering into the plaza outside and enjoying one of the many parades and free music events held most evenings.

623741042.name: Stunning building
623741042.author: a TripAdvisor user
623741042.reviewBody: The entire city center is remarkable and worth a visit...these old buildings are well kept and beautiful..

462150518.name: History
462150518.author: a TripAdvisor user
462150518.reviewBody: Spent the night in Colima to watch the Horse parade, it was amazing. The next morning we did a walk about in the area. Lots to see, we went into the Palace, a beautiful building with amazing murals on the walls. I can only imagine it\'s grandness in the day. I would love to see dances or high end dinners in there it would be amazing.

402903231.name: To all it may comcern from Leon P and Deborah Alices daughter and steven ellis realsis
402903231.author: a TripAdvisor user
402903231.reviewBody: Tell all w that I found a piece of paper us bank with Kaylee Riddle and Sharon L Landry with a cc 007B206638\nI also found a number that the family or wifes of the family might nfind interesteing  330552360in spanish it says clave de reservationh K5JTKF  I hope it does some good because it is a lagitamite settlement not a informant acct no I am not a hooker or a good good luck hope it helps 574789249 2031

123415206.name: Stunning city stunning art and a party every night in the plaza
123415206.author: a TripAdvisor user
123415206.reviewBody: While a big part of me would like to keep Colima under wraps, the other part of me wants to share what a wonderful place this is with so many public museums and galleries your head will swim. The murals on the stairway in the Federal Palace are very famous. But wander over to the Pinacoteca and see contemporary artists to rival New York. Or to the Galeria Monica Saucedo where yup my art work is shown too. The dancing dogs of Colima are famous and the area has a rich history with its own ancient ruins too. A truly charming and special place.

650603474.name: Hippos need water!
650603474.author: a TripAdvisor user
650603474.reviewBody: The hippos need some water they can submerge themselves in to.  They are semi-aquatic animals!  The big cats need some space, not the tiny enclosures they are subjected to.  The monkeys need more space to swing and play.  All the exhibits seemed to lack water, for drinking or playing.  It\'s a great bird enclosure and it\'s really thrilling to be able to feed carrots to giraffes, but it did not make up for the deficiencies.

address.streetAddress: Calle Santos Degollado S/N Col Centro

441016947.name: Bien, pero le falta que lo impulsen como sitio tur\u00edstico
441016947.author: a TripAdvisor user
441016947.reviewBody: Es muy bonito el arroyo, con aguas tranquilas cristalinas que al pasar por el cauce hacen un efecto de burbujas en el agua y por eso se le llama a este Sitio "El Hervidero". Sus aguas son templadas y en la mayor parte no son profundas. Los locatarios de los alrededores cobran una cuota representativa en la entrada pero le hace falta que le den mantenimiento a los ba\u00f1os. Tambi\u00e9n te cobran por el uso de mesas y sillas pero necesitan hacer reparaciones en los techos y palapas. El sitio tiene potencial como tur\u00edstico para el estado de Colima, m\u00e1s porque est\u00e1 alejado de la ciudad y tiene su aire campestre como de aventura. Ojal\u00e1 se ponga foco en este tipo de  lugares y haya mayor inversi\u00f3n.

659066358.name: Ask me about an 80 year old zip lining!
659066358.author: a TripAdvisor user
659066358.reviewBody: You gotta know the different choices available for the person who wants to zip, especially if it is the first time and what to do if your over 80. I have done it in Costa Rica and Acapulo, Mx and the Copper Canyon in MX is next.. Stay tuned!.

649302565.name: Explored the lower slopes with Admire Mexico
649302565.author: a TripAdvisor user
649302565.reviewBody: We have twice been out to the lower slopes with Jupiter, of Admire Mexico tours.   Jupiter most recently took us birdwatching and we saw over 40 species in a few hours on the lower slopes of the volcano.   Also pleasant is a visit to a tiny coffee plantation.   Beautiful.

622216495.name: most active volcano in Mexico
622216495.author: a TripAdvisor user
622216495.reviewBody: The views are stunning, the hiking was great, the lake nearby was beautiful and the company that I was keeping was incredible..all in all, a lovely day.

608254987.name: Exceptional Tourism
608254987.author: a TripAdvisor user
608254987.reviewBody: You can visit Colima and their active Volcan de Fuego and you will never forget it!! This is one of that incredibles places to see with your own eyes because you can\'t live the full experience in other different way. Only you, on your own feets, with your own eyes. This place is unbelievable. Nice trip!

571744190.name: Climb to peak with Florencio.
571744190.author: a TripAdvisor user
571744190.reviewBody: Florencio was our guide to the peak. 7 hours of hiking for a 55 year old out of shape. Altitude sickness is a real thing! Hardest thing I have ever done and I would do it again if I had the chance.

551561963.name: Viewed from afar...
551561963.author: a TripAdvisor user
551561963.reviewBody: We only viewed the volcano from afar, we were on the bus to Colima, however it was good enough to continually spew smoke from the top much to our excitement.

539196847.name: passing
539196847.author: a TripAdvisor user
539196847.reviewBody: some days you can see and others cloud or foggy but place is very nice travelling by bus is the best way to go the scenery is exellent.

482696358.name: Nice and photogenic volcano.
482696358.author: a TripAdvisor user
482696358.reviewBody: It rumbles, spews lava and if you get too near you almost surely won\'t make it back alive, as any respectable volcano does. Photographs are good, pick your spot and wait for the action to begin, it can disappoint but you aren\'t paying any money so no complains in that regard.

478699676.name: Good hike nice view!
478699676.author: a TripAdvisor user
478699676.reviewBody: Nice hike, be aware you need a 4wd to get there (16k dirt road with big potholes).. I didn\'t have one.. and well.. not recommended.. the hike itself is great, easy to find. For first timers, a guide could be welcoming..

477598357.name: A great volcano with high activity
477598357.author: a TripAdvisor user
477598357.reviewBody: The first time we see that volcano it was from an ancient temple site, it has a huge effect on me. Than we get closer to that volcano, we could observe a tiny smoke, we see volcanic rocks and minerals. \u0130t was a nice experience, if you are close to that region try to create a chance of hiking on that volcano, with all its forest, river, country site it will be an amazing trip.

472526331.name: The volcano was very active so we have great pictures
472526331.author: a TripAdvisor user
472526331.reviewBody: You have to see it in person :-) It will get your adrenaline going it was the highlight of my trip and the food was great love the Taco near by my Hotel Mision Colima.

458571492.name: Smoking Beauty ;-)
458571492.author: a TripAdvisor user
458571492.reviewBody: It was my first time viewing a volcano and wow what an experience. There was an eruption just 2 weeks prior to our trip but it looked regal and majestic even when it was calm just spewing some smoke. It\'s a must visit if you have never seen a volcano.

451550858.name: Spectacular and easy to get to from Manzanillo
451550858.author: a TripAdvisor user
451550858.reviewBody: It is a must see.  Take a tour up to see the volcano\'s.  Learn the history of the country side. There are many unique birds and other wild life that can be seen,  Make sure you stop and grab a cup of coffee that is famous in this region.

428281874.name: Photography trip
428281874.author: a TripAdvisor user
428281874.reviewBody: Fantastic emotional exploration and adventure trip, this volcano is active and you can take probably some really interesting shoots

421151770.name: Smokin
421151770.author: a TripAdvisor user
421151770.reviewBody: We try to get up to Comala at least once a year in the winter. The views of the volcano are amazing, the road has been updated and much easier to travel on. Stop along the way, and visit the coffee plantations, and some great restaurants. Most English speaking. Stop in Comala and just sit in the square and people watch. Try to go when cruise ships Are Not in Port less busy.

415833940.name: youngest of the three and one of the most active volcanos in Mexico and in North America
415833940.author: a TripAdvisor user
415833940.reviewBody: We went on road trip from Guadalajara to Colima, but instead taking diversion from Ciudad Guzman into highway 429 to main entrance, we took route to small village called Tonila which is on the way to Manzanillo. The road will end after few kilometers from Tonila, and you can hike through private farms to get better view of Volcano - only if you seek bit more adventure.

398220917.name: Amazing!
398220917.author: a TripAdvisor user
398220917.reviewBody: This is an amazing volcano! Good walk and good views, the guide knows all you have to kown and make you feel safety...

381743174.name: Volcano fantastico!
381743174.author: a TripAdvisor user
381743174.reviewBody: Went on a tour with Ray and Eva.  First rate and the volcano was awe inspiring.  Worth the trip and tons of information.

374824255.name: too much smog
374824255.author: a TripAdvisor user
374824255.reviewBody: If you\'re visiting Colima to view the volcano\'s, be sure you are there at a time when the farmers are not burning their fields.  The smog from the burning make it impossible to view the volcano\'s

372743800.name: Incredible a volcano next to a another
372743800.author: a TripAdvisor user
372743800.reviewBody: This is a unique active volcano that frequently  smokes ! And is next to an other that sometimes has snow, so you can see a snowed inactive volcano next to an other one that smokes!! Unbelievable!! I haven\'t see in any other part of the word something like this! Definitely a place to visit! Wow!!

368043719.name: Not much to see.
368043719.author: a TripAdvisor user
368043719.reviewBody: You don\'t need to go any closer than to the edge of the city. The vulcano looms over colima. It photographs well because its shape is veey conical.

360514419.name: Awesome!
360514419.author: a TripAdvisor user
360514419.reviewBody: While we had heard that this is an active volcano that tends to scare off many tourists, our local friends set us at ease and we set out to do several outings with different and beautiful views of the volcano... and were treated  day after day!

357186796.name: We drove to the base of the volcano,,,great views, bit out of the way, but terrific views.
357186796.author: a TripAdvisor user
357186796.reviewBody: Volcano is fairly easy to access, if you\'re mobile and not too conservative. Rural folks are quite friendly.  Old Mexico.

351289319.name: Fun & Educational
351289319.author: a TripAdvisor user
351289319.reviewBody: Choose Admire Mexico to take you to view the Volcano and see the sites of Colima. Jupiter will show you the hidden gems not found on a map.

345846806.name: Great adventure
345846806.author: a TripAdvisor user
345846806.reviewBody: The very special town of comala offers a road map and tour operators for the region.  Just driving up to Yerba buenos the ghost town to a fabulous lookout is wonderful. On the way there is the magic road which pulls you backwards on flat ground.  There is a coffee road detour that takes you on a breathtaking road through magnificent scenery and eventually to a horse area of some of the finest looking horses you have ever seen. But back to the road to the volcano which takes you by a crater lake where you can rent out cabins.  The volcano blows smoke all the time and the close up shots are really impressive. Apparently there are some significant people studying the volcano.

344842162.name: Amazing
344842162.author: a TripAdvisor user
344842162.reviewBody: It is an amazing experience, I was almost at top and I can say this is a great experience. It is a little cold over there but still nice

344162058.name: Best View
344162058.author: a TripAdvisor user
344162058.reviewBody:
You can go to Laguna Carrizalillo, it has the best accommodation for the view of the volcano. There is a hotel, a one story flat, next to the lake. I stayed there for 3 days. It was super awesome to have the complete view, the smoky volcano, jungle, lake, and the reflection of the volcano in the water right from the room window. At the sunset it looked magical, like Jurassic Park, as if the dinasours were walking around somewhere. The room was big, with bathroom, and cost only 300 peso. 

There are also some houses/suites with kitchen, cost more but not next to the lake. Camping, BBQ, kids playground also available. On the weekends there were hundreds of locals but only a few during weekdays, and very few stay over night. Only saw one foreign couple the whole time so guess not many tourists know this place, that's why I'm putting it on TA. You can eat some meals at the restaurant Thurs - Sun, but better to do picnic or BBQ, bring your own pot and pans. If you don't have one it's possible to borrow from them, but looks like they only have one or two, it's their own. It's better to bring your own food, but there is also a small store nearby with basic supply to make meals. 

The staff were super nice, the widow of the room were glass stripes and 3 were missing, they replaced it right away. It's much colder at night than in town, they got me extra blanket and even a electric heater, though to most people you won't find it necessary at all.  When restaurant was closed they even allowed me to use the kitchen from there suite to cook. Muchas gracias a todo el personal en Laguna Carrizalillo :D

The bus from Colima takes about one hour drops you off right in front the gate. But the schedule is about every 2 hours so better to check before you go. There is also a small town called Comala quite nice with all white one story houses, you can stop by on your way back, the bus between there and Colima every half an hour.

342625058.name: A must in Colima!
342625058.author: a TripAdvisor user
342625058.reviewBody: The hike up to Nevado de Colima was on our to-do list in Mexico, and it lived up and exceeded our expectations. The view was fantastic, we saw five "fumaroles" during our day! Our guide Florencio from Coraz\u00f3n de Colima Tours was amazing, he was very knowledgeable about the volcano and the region and made the hike to the summit safe and enjoyable. The 360 view from the summit is absolutely spectacular, we could see from the top of the volcano all the way down to the plains 3,000m below. We needed to pace ourselves and not go too fast because of the high altitude, but it was well worth the effort. We highly recommend this activity if you\'re around the city of Colima.

340343249.name: The volcano is active...
340343249.author: a TripAdvisor user
340343249.reviewBody: I\'ve said quite a bit about this is my hostel review, but it really is a great experience and I recommend doing the trip with Alex at El Litchee hostel

321965748.name: Awesome!
321965748.author: a TripAdvisor user
321965748.reviewBody: Only viewed from a distance, but we saw it dormant first and then moments later, steam filled the air.  So cool!!

296152178.name: Seeing is believing
296152178.author: a TripAdvisor user
296152178.reviewBody: One active volcano with a larger dormant volcano right next door.  It has been very active lately and threatening residents.  You can drive up from the city of Colima, thru Comala, Suchytlan and Cofradia de Sucytlan with great vistas along the way.

285568954.name: Valcano
285568954.author: a TripAdvisor user
285568954.reviewBody: It was fantastic..simply fantastic.......I have visited five time the valcano during my stay at colima

267308702.name: Possibly the bost spot in Colima
267308702.author: a TripAdvisor user
267308702.reviewBody: Excellent view! Nice place even for camping!!! Enjoy a day hiking and take some great shots! Totally recommended.

265834999.name: The Volcano was great
265834999.author: a TripAdvisor user
265834999.reviewBody: If you have never been up and close this is a great one to hike. Not far from Villa Parasio Manzanillo, where we stayed. The hike was beautiful and only a short distance. We then went back to Colima to site see and eat.

265292314.name: If you find the time , you should go and camp there !
265292314.author: a TripAdvisor user
265292314.reviewBody:
You have to drive a dirt road up to a Rangers gate and pay some admission. You should have a 4x4 car for the road. During dry weather season a normal suv will also do. Drive up and down the hill carefully because the native people there might drive fast or will use motorbikes or quads. Also mountain bikers are using the hill up and down.
When you enter the national park you have the possibility to camp nearby the gate. You just drive down and pass the Rangers house and some gardens and agriculture fields. 
There is also a public wash and bathroom. 
A little bit after this buildings are several camp areas. There are not too much accommodation, you have to bring everything from the villages at the bottom of the hill. So be sure to bring everything!
If you want to go further up the hill you still can drive closer to the top hill.
About 400 m vertical height before the top, there is a parking spot and from there you must walk. It's about a 45 yo 1 hour walk and you should be in good health condition.
At the top of the hill you will have a unique view over the valleys and to the volcano fuego de Colima.

265242443.name: Mexice vacation
265242443.author: a TripAdvisor user
265242443.reviewBody: This was the most amazing vacation ever! The lush green tropical paradise. would go back again, plan on it in the near future!

253581168.name: puffing
253581168.author: a TripAdvisor user
253581168.reviewBody: it was a great day for the volcano which has been active recently. Today we saw some rather large plumes of smoke. I recommend heading out to see it early because as the day went on it was covered in clouds

253531136.name: A day near the volcano
253531136.author: a TripAdvisor user
253531136.reviewBody: We have visited this area a number of tmes and with each visit we gained a new appreciation for the volcano and surrounding area. We a lways enjoy driving to Colima as we can see the mountain puffing away, sometimes with great force.  Visiting the area, due to the active volano makes it feel like we are vising an old friend. There are a number of quaint Mexican towns near the volcano that are both beautiful in their own right and als provide great views of the volcano. If one is so inclined, taking a traditional meal while enjoying the view and the ambience makes it even more special. two favourite places are the MESON DONA RAFA in a village called Ocotillo and the HACIENDA just off hwy 200. Old Mexico at its finest and great food!

252646374.name: if you lucky, you will see some smoke, but does not looks like a volcano.
252646374.author: a TripAdvisor user
252646374.reviewBody:
Not sure why even sunny day, the volcano still looks haze covered. Barely see it and only a mountain shape on the far north.

Tried to drive close, but its waste time and gas only. 

But anyway, if you goes to Colima, worth to find a empty area and look it on north.

249841639.name: Lovely vistas
249841639.author: a TripAdvisor user
249841639.reviewBody: Didn\'t hike but enjoyed views of volcanos. I\'m sure there are some pleasant hikes. Nearby towns were disappointing

248455912.name: Spectacular show of nature
248455912.author: a TripAdvisor user
248455912.reviewBody: We were on a family vacation visiting relatives in El Grullo, Jalisco, Mexico when we realised that the active volcano in Colima was only a couple of hours drive away. Having local knowledge from my wife\'s sister, we were able to drive through Parque Nacional Volcan Nevado de Colima without getting lost. This was an amazing drive on a well-maintained two-lane road through the park. We drove through beautiful terrain and canyons. The surrounding topography is like no other we\'ve seen. The volcano, which was only venting steam and not currently erupting (last eruption was April 2014) keep reappearing around every other bend. Our eight-year-old could not take his eyes off of this spectacular show of nature. A day trip we will not soon forget!

231383811.name: Active Valcano
231383811.author: a TripAdvisor user
231383811.reviewBody: Valcano shos signs of active smoke.  Beautiful views of this 16,000 foot Valcano from the Hotel room.

221369449.name: Beautiful like always!
221369449.author: a TripAdvisor user
221369449.reviewBody: I am from Colima and coming back to visit and see the Volcano was amazing, just like always! We stayed at my uncle\'s ranch, which is just a few kilometers from the entrances of the volcano.

214846500.name: VOLCANOS "EL FUEGO" (FIRE) AND "LA NIEVE" (ICE)
214846500.author: a TripAdvisor user
214846500.reviewBody: Upon approaching the City of Colima from either side, the extraordinary site of the volcanos "El Fuego" and "La Nieve" will take your breadth away!!\n\nIt is in the early morning while approaching the City that they are the most clearly seen and at times you can be lucky enough to see a puff or two reach out from the site of the active one, "El Fuego"  It is the best free Tourist site available in our area. Don\'t miss it!!!!

192177480.name: Fantastic tour and watched an eruption
192177480.author: a TripAdvisor user
192177480.reviewBody: Jupiter Rivera who operates a B&B in Comala Mexico (Casa Alvarada) also provides tours of the Colima Volcano.  This is a very active volcano which sends plumbs of smoke up daily, and he took us a few miles from the town where we got a fantastic view of the volcano and were able to take great photos of the volcano activity.  We also visited a coffee plantation on the same tour.  Jupiter speaks fluent English and Spanish and is an accredited tour guide, he knows the area well and provided an abundant amount of information.\nAnyone who is visiting the area of Manzanillo, Lake Chapala or Guadalajara should plan to take this tour as it is something you should not miss while in the area.  Two thumbs up to Jupiter.  casa_alvarada@hotmail.com

133173249.name: The Great Arbor
133173249.author: a TripAdvisor user
133173249.reviewBody: Travel to Erbabuena and above on the old road to the right at the organic coffee factory.  At the top end of the road, park and walk to the one of the largest and religious ceremonial trees in North America.  Clean air, beautiful view of volcano, and hiking, photo ops galor.   Enjoy and be at peace with the earth.

125845080.name: Colima & Comala- jewels in Mexico Interior
125845080.author: a TripAdvisor user
125845080.reviewBody: We drove with friends to Colima-beautiful, clean central square, had breakfast at the outdoor restaurant at Ceballos Hotel.  The food was mediocre, but the hotel was a beautiful restoration.  We were fortunate enough to be there at the beginning of their Lent pre-celebrations, so there was a parade in the square, followed by the bull-fights the next day (which we were sorry to miss).  There was a lovely tourist office in the square with helpful staff.  We were able to book an afternoon tour of the area with a very friendly, knowledgeable tour operator, Florencio from Corazon de Colima Tours.  We drove toward the volcano (didn\'t have enough time to hike to it), experienced the Zona Magica, a lagoon where coffee is grown, a coffee "factory" and Comala, another beautiful town with an outdoor restaurant in the central square.  Their specialty is "punches"-buy a drink & the tapas keep coming until you tell them to stop.  For 3 drinks & all we could eat, plus tip, the bill was under $10!  If we had known earlier, we would have stayed in that area for a few days, & taken tours to the surrounding pueblos.\nWe took the ETN bus back to Manzanillo-luxurious, express bus & very cheap.  There is a huge difference between the local buses & the city-to-city express buses.  It\'s fun taking both!\nWe were very impressed with Florencio\'s guiding & would recommend him to anyone taking a tour in that area.  His web site is www.corazondecolimatours.com.

123920981.name: Need to see
123920981.author: a TripAdvisor user
123920981.reviewBody: Took a guide.  He spoke in english.  Very nice guy.  knew what he was talking about.\n\n

121882892.name: Smokin\'
121882892.author: a TripAdvisor user
121882892.reviewBody: It isn\'t every day that one sees a live volcano.  That is unless you spend time in Colima, Colima Mexico.  It is majestic, on occasion smoke will be trailing out of its peak, I frequently drive through Colima and never fail to be impressed.  You can\'t be in or near the city and miss it.

119531620.name: Vista Molto Bella
119531620.author: a TripAdvisor user
119531620.reviewBody: I have to say the view is spectacular and when the volcano exhales smoke it is quite a site to be seen. On each of my trips to Colima I hope for clear skies so that I mat have another look at the beautiful view the volcano provides.  Most spectacular.

117311338.name: breathtaking
117311338.author: a TripAdvisor user
117311338.reviewBody: the view of this on the road there beautiful. Don\'t forget your camera.

365279785.name: Murals on stairway highlight history of area.
365279785.author: a TripAdvisor user
365279785.reviewBody: The tourist information center is in the building and they were helpful if you speak Spanish. Very little English spoken in area, but a tour of building was available in English. The architecture is interesting with the open courtyards. Different views of Cathedrals bell towers.

230803756.name: Good for a quick visit
230803756.author: a TripAdvisor user
230803756.reviewBody: This review is rather for the el centro. The area is quite small with a few decent buildings. Nothing is attractive or phenominal to talk about. I particularly like the calmness of the town and the slow pace of life here. we had lunch in el centro and enjoyed a local band. The food is below average but I guess my expectation is not that high when I set foot here so the overall experience is OK. In short, it is interesting to see a capital of a state in Mexico. It is about 90-minute drive from Manzanillo but I do not recommend to visit this town unless you have plenty of time.

400012955.name: Adrenaline rush.... Zip Lining at Naturacamp
400012955.author: a TripAdvisor user
400012955.reviewBody: There are any things to do and see at Naturacamp.... we go for the zip lining.  \nThe people that work at the Naturacamp are caring and always put safety first.  This July we took my 20 year granddaughter and her friend zip lining.  We have accompanied my families with children as small as 7 years old. The trek up the mountain and across the suspension bridge is worth the walk....   The view is spectacular.  Then hang on!!!  The first of 5 zip lines is the tallest and longest.  The guides are good with instructions and I always feel safe riding the lines at Naturacamp.  The reward at the end is great pizza and fruit juices.  It is well worth the money and fun for the whole family.  I\'m 66 years old and will continue to zip line for as long as I am able.

271816079.name: Tampumacchay-Archeological site of shaft tombs is CLOSED
271816079.author: a TripAdvisor user
271816079.reviewBody: This is an archeological site about "Shaft Tombs". Even getting information about this site was confusing. It\'s location was hard to find. The best way to get there is from the city of Colima (Capital of the state of Colima), from the quota carretera going south towards Manzanillo, exit at Los Osmoles and continue to Los Ortices. On the other side of this village you will see a sign on the right-hand side for Tampumacchay Hotel (double wide gate entrance is on your left). When we went we were lucky to talk to a local person walking on the road who accompanied us all the way through our visit. A previous rain storm had left the 1/2 kilometre entrance full of very deep ruts so we left our vehicle on the small village road and walked in. Our impromptu guide gave us the names and information about the trees and plants we could see along the way. We finally got to the Tampumacchay Hotel and found it locked up with no one there. We could see a locked gate further in which was for the site we had come to see. A woman watering plants at the neighbouring property where there was a huge swimming pool gave us the information that the site was CLOSED with no known date that it would reopen. She walked us over to the hotel and showed us a display window where the hotel had a great number of artifacts that came from this archeological site. I took pictures of these as proof that we had at least something for our effort. Mexico is always an adventure where we can find something amazing or tragically deteriorating from lack of funds. Supposedly this site contains rare examples of shaft tombs and maybe an underground cave that can be explored but sadly we can not confirm this.

448388225.name: Encuentras todo para tu negocio
448388225.author: a TripAdvisor user
448388225.reviewBody: Encuentras todo para tu negocio. Precios accesibles y ahora con estacionamiento para tu mayor comodidad en las compras.

425923752.name: Excelente surtido
425923752.author: a TripAdvisor user
425923752.reviewBody: Esta tienda esta muy bien surtida y puedes encontrar todo lo necesario para hacer pasteles o postres, van sacando mucha mercanc\u00eda de temporada para adornar los pasteles

364261648.name: REGULAR
364261648.author: a TripAdvisor user
364261648.reviewBody: Los precios son un poco altos pero tienen todo lo que necesitas para iniciar tu negocio de reposter\u00eda o restaurante, pero la atenci\u00f3n deja mucho que desear.

337670997.name: Todo lo que necesitas para tu negocio repostero lo encuentras
337670997.author: a TripAdvisor user
337670997.reviewBody: Todo lo que necesitas para tu negocio repostero lo encuentras.\nHay excelente mercanc\u00eda a un muy buen precio. Variedad. Y adem\u00e1s ahora tienen estacionamiento exclusivo para tu mayor comodidad. \nEs el mejor lugar para surtir lo necesario para tu establecimiento.

236026047.name: S\u00faper buena las clases de reposter\u00eda y cocina
236026047.author: a TripAdvisor user
236026047.reviewBody: He asistido a varios de los cursos tanto de reposter\u00eda como cursos navide\u00f1os y totalmente recomendable, chefs muy preparados y las clases muy completas :)

235432431.name: Nueva Experiencia!
235432431.author: a TripAdvisor user
235432431.reviewBody: Provamos un curso que hab\u00eda de Reposter\u00eda y chocolates! la verdad que lo disfrutamos much\u00edsimo. Algo diferente, siempre es bueno intentar algo nuevo! El personal muy atento. Instalaciones amplias limpias y con todo lo necesario para el Curso!

235354297.name: Nos Encanto la Clases
235354297.author: a TripAdvisor user
235354297.reviewBody: Salimos muy pero muy contentas con la clase de reposteria del ultimo curso de la semana pasada!\nTotalmente recomendare esto a mis amigos. Nos reimos con el Chef y sobretodo aprendimos varios secretos de copmo trabajar con el chocolate y el fondant!

634256268.name: Desagradable experiencia
634256268.author: a TripAdvisor user
634256268.reviewBody: De lo m\u00e1s deprimente el lugar, mi hija quer\u00eda conocer, y la lleve, los animales en estado deplorable, hab\u00eda un Pony con un ojo s\u00faper infectado, los pobres burritos y las jirafas flacas te persiguen esperando les des de comer, yo no termine de recorrerlo, me quede en la parte de las aves obviamente tambi\u00e9n muy hambrientas, mi hija y su amiga gastaron su dinero en las m\u00e1quinas expendedoras de semillas, me enamoro un tuc\u00e1n muy fotog\u00e9nico, pero definitivamente no vuelvo \ud83d\ude21\ud83d\ude21\ud83d\ude21\ud83d\ude21, animales en mal estado todo muy triste yo sal\u00ed con el coraz\u00f3n partido

address.streetAddress: Santos Degollado S/N 20 de Noviembre, Col. Colima Centro
